summary:
Alberta is a province in western Canada, bordered by mountains and plains. It's known for its natural beauty and oil industry. With a population of over 4 million, its main cities are Edmonton (the capital) and Calgary. English is the official language.

Historically, Alberta was home to First Nations and was a territory for fur traders. It became a province in 1905 and gained fame for its oil reserves after 1947. Alberta has a strong economy, mainly due to its oil, gas, and agricultural industries. It's also famous for its unique landscapes and fossil sites.
title: Alberta
